page.title: 07HOUSING IN CROUGHTON 2
page.content: In 1984 plans were announced to build 300 new houses on land at RAF Croughton to accommodate USAF personnel from Croughton and Upper Heyford. Vigorous campaigning from parish and district councils and many local individuals led to the eventual withdrawal of the proposal, and the houses are now to be built at Bicester. Significant factors of this project were that the houses were to be financed by the US government who had already allocated the funds to be used within the financial year 1984, and that MoD could in fact have gone ahead without agreement from any other body. The main burden of the village's protest was the total imbalance that the introduction of such a large American community would create within the village.
